Class Animation

      • prepareEnterAnimation

        public java.util.ArrayList<ChartSet> prepareEnterAnimation(ChartView chartView)
        Method that prepares the enter animation. Defines starting points, targets, distance, yadda, as well as the first set of points to be drawn.
        Parameters:
        chartView - ChartView to be invalidate each time the animation wants to update values and to get the ChartSet containing the target values
        Returns:

      • getEndAction

        public java.lang.Runnable getEndAction()

      • setEasing

        public Animation setEasing(BaseEasingMethod easing)
        Animation easing will be managed differently depending on which Easing object is defined. Also , depending of which operation gets applied to the chart - enter, exit and update - the easing will interpolate accordingly, as following described: enter animation with easeOut; exit animation with easeIn; and update with easeInOut. In order to force a different behaviour one can extend BaseEasingMethod.
        Parameters:
        easing - Easing object responsible to interpolate animation values
        Returns:
        Animation self-reference.

      • setDuration

        public Animation setDuration(int duration)
        Parameters:
        duration -
        Returns:
        Animation self-reference.

      • setOverlap

        public Animation setOverlap(float factor,
                            int[] order)
        Sets whether entries should be animate in sequence or parallel.
        Parameters:
        factor - value from 0 to 1 that tells how much will be the overlap of an entry's animation according to the previous one 0 - no overlap 1 - all entries animate in parallel (default)
        order - order from which the entries will be animated { 0, 1, 2, 3, ...} - default order
        Returns:
        Animation self-reference.

      • setEndAction

        public Animation setEndAction(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Sets an action to be executed once the animation finishes.
        Parameters:
        runnable - to be executed once the animation finishes
        Returns:
        Animation self-reference.

      • setStartPoint

        public Animation setStartPoint(float xFactor,
                               float yFactor)
        Sets the starting point for the animation. Eg. xFactor=0; yFactor=0; starts the animation on the bottom left corner of the inner chart area.
        Parameters:
        xFactor - horizontal factor between 0 and 1. If not applied then -1 can be set.
        yFactor - vertical factor between 0 and 1. If not applied then -1 can be set.
        Returns:
        Animation self-reference.

      • setAlpha

        public Animation setAlpha(int speed)
        Sets an alpha speed to animation. To disable alpha set it to -1. Eg. If speed 2 alpha goes twice faster than translation.
        Parameters:
        speed - speed of alpha animation values according with translation.
        Returns:
        Animation self-reference.
